title: If you're a person who prefers to listen, can you say why? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a few reasons I prefer to listen instead of talking. I’m really shy to people I don’t know well.If they want to have a conversation, that’s fine, but it’s hard for me to talk to them and the conversations don’t usually last long.I’m not very good with words and am interested in things many people aren’t, such as Mandarin TV shows.I’m not interested in a lot of things my peers like to talk about, like popular American musicians, TV shows like Grey’s Anatomy, etc. I don’t listen to or watch them, so there’s not much I can say.I may have something to contribute to the conversation, but would rather hear other people’s opinions. Of course, if somebody wants my opinion I’ll give it.Often, my friends talk really quickly anyway and by the time they pause long enough for me to get a word in edgewise they’ll have completely moved on.There’s so much you can learn from listening to others.This is why I prefer to listen in class instead of present. This is also how I found out some things about certain people, which lowered my admiration for them a bit. It’s how I learned how to filter gossip and to only really believe something about someone if they say so themselves, and if they’re not someone who would lie to get attention. It’s how I learn things about people who are important to me, be it their favorite color or what they hope the future holds for them. It’s how I began to be introduced to things I never even knew existed while sheltered from the world. Listening to others is how I was introduced to opinions different than those my dad tried to shove down our throat at home, and how I came to realize it’s okay to accept things outside of the norm.It’s how I learned about different kind of people, thoughts, ideas, opinions, beliefs, and more. Listening to others is how I became who I am today.

I learned a LONG time ago in Sales that talking is NOT selling, “Listening IS selling!” You say so what? That's not what I asked! Ok, the REASON I prefer to listen is WE as a whole, are ALWAYS selling something! Be it ourselves, an idea, a point of view, a friendship, what ever you think of, WE sell it. What MOST people are looking for in a friend in this life, is someone to REALLY LISTEN to them! Not just hear them and nod, but to truly listen, add up the facts, and give them solid advice, IF they seek it. Or just to listen and tell them what EVERYONE really wants to hear. That is, “Everything is going to be alright!” Then tell them WHY! Any one can just SAY it. But, IF you truly listen, you CAN give reasons WHY it will be alright. If you Truly do Listen, you will become one of the most popular people in ANY group, be it at work or at social events. I OFTEN times feel like I have a stamp on my forehead that says, “TALK TO ME!” I don't know why it is? I am often told it's my eyes. (As these are Total Strangers that just walk up to me and start telling me some of their most intimate secrets and problems. At parties, at work, in Walmart, buying food, just standing outside a shop at the mall waiting for my wife even!) I have NO CLUE WHY?? I have always been popular, but once I stopped talking so much, and I Really started listening instead, my popularity really grew! In my personal life, and my business life as well. That's WHY I listen.
